targets.rawSql:
SELECT
  title::TEXT AS title
FROM
  datapresenter.views
WHERE
  id = $view

WITH statuses AS (
  SELECT 1 AS id, NOW() AS timestamp, 150 AS last_record, 'Connected' AS value
  UNION ALL
  SELECT 2 AS id, NOW() AS timestamp, -1 AS last_record, 'Connection error' AS value
  UNION ALL
  SELECT 3 AS id, NOW() AS timestamp, -500 AS last_record, 'Calculated point' AS value
  UNION ALL
  SELECT 4 AS id, NOW() AS timestamp, NULL AS last_record, 'Connection error' AS value
)
SELECT
  timestamp,
  last_record,
  value
FROM
  statuses
/* This WHERE clause makes the query text change when the variable changes.
  This forces the panel to request a new random value instead of showing a cached one.
  Replace 'electrometer' with the name of your dashboard variable.
*/
WHERE '${view}' IS NOT NULL 
ORDER BY
  RANDOM()
LIMIT 1;

WITH child_data AS (
  SELECT
    n.id,
    n.description,
    n.type_string,
    CASE
      WHEN n.type = 'real' THEN 'üïõ Re√°lny merac√≠ bod'
      WHEN n.type = 'virtual' THEN 'üì± Virtu√°lny merac√≠ bod'
      WHEN n.type = 'residual' THEN '‚öñÔ∏è Zostatkov√Ω merac√≠ bod'
    END AS type
  FROM
    datapresenter.nodes n
    JOIN datapresenter.views v ON n.id = v.main_node_id
    AND v.id = $view
)
SELECT
  ch.*,
  v.name AS parent_view
FROM
  child_data ch,
  datapresenter.views v,
  datapresenter.edges e
WHERE
  v.main_node_id = e.parent_id
  AND e.child_id = ch.id

SELECT
  n.title,
  n.location_lat AS lat,
  n.location_lon AS lon,
  n.geojson AS geojson
FROM
  datapresenter.nodes n
JOIN
  datapresenter.views v
ON
  n.id = v.main_node_id AND v.id = $view

/*DATA PRESENTER QUERY
 
 This part will select all real measurements connected to the displayed view. The result will be used for any needed calculation.
 */
--Select a real node or if the selected node is virtual, select all it's real supply nodes
WITH RECURSIVE params AS (
  SELECT
    n.id AS node_id
  FROM
    datapresenter.nodes n
    JOIN datapresenter.views v ON n.id = v.main_node_id
    AND v.id = $view
),
-- The recursive CTE to find all REAL supplier nodes through a downward traversal
real_suppliers AS (
  -- Anchor: The selected node to start the traversal
  SELECT
    n.id,
    n.type,
    n.title,
    0 AS level,
    ARRAY [n.id] AS path
  FROM
    datapresenter.nodes n
    JOIN params p ON n.id = p.node_id
  UNION
  ALL -- Recursive part: Find the children of the current set of nodes
  SELECT
    c.id,
    c.type,
    c.title,
    rs.level + 1 AS level,
    rs.path || c.id AS path
  FROM
    real_suppliers rs
    JOIN datapresenter.edges e ON rs.id = e.parent_id
    JOIN datapresenter.nodes c ON e.child_id = c.id
  WHERE
    e.edge_type :: TEXT IN ('supply', 'aggregate')
    AND c.id <> ALL(rs.path) -- Cycle detection
),
--If a node is a remainder, find all it's siblings and prepare a recipe for calculating the consumption.
parent_params AS(
  SELECT
    e.parent_id
  FROM
    datapresenter.edges e
  WHERE
    e.child_id = (
      SELECT
        node_id
      FROM
        params
    )
    AND e.edge_type :: TEXT = 'remainder'
),
-- The universal recursive CTE to find all REAL descendants, preserving the original child's context
child_recipes AS (
  -- Anchor: The direct children of the parent
  SELECT
    n.id AS node_id,
    n.type AS node_type,
    n.title AS node_name,
    n.measurement_name,
    e.child_id AS top_child_id,
    e.edge_type AS top_child_edge_type,
    n.title AS top_child_name,
    ARRAY [n.id] AS path
  FROM
    datapresenter.nodes n
    JOIN datapresenter.edges e ON n.id = e.child_id
  WHERE
    e.parent_id = (
      SELECT
        parent_id
      FROM
        parent_params
    ) -- We filter the anchor to not include the residual node itself, as its recipe is different
    AND e.edge_type :: TEXT <> 'remainder'
  UNION
  ALL -- Recursive part: Find the suppliers for the current virtual nodes
  SELECT
    c.id AS node_id,
    c.type AS node_type,
    c.title AS node_name,
    c.measurement_name,
    cr.top_child_id,
    cr.top_child_edge_type,
    cr.top_child_name,
    cr.path || c.id AS path
  FROM
    child_recipes cr
    JOIN datapresenter.edges e ON cr.node_id = e.parent_id
    JOIN datapresenter.nodes c ON e.child_id = c.id
  WHERE
    cr.node_type :: TEXT <> 'real' -- Stop when we hit a REAL node
    AND c.id <> ALL(cr.path) -- Cycle detection
    -- Only traverse 'supply' and 'aggregate' edges
    AND e.edge_type :: TEXT IN ('supply', 'aggregate')
),
-- Final recipe for calculating of the consumption.
node_list AS (
  -- Real or virtual node selected
  -- Final SELECT to get the real nodes found in the traversal, all with a +1 sign
  SELECT
    DISTINCT n.id AS real_node_id,
    n.title AS node_name,
    n.measurement_name AS measurement,
    + 1 AS sign
  FROM
    real_suppliers rs
    JOIN datapresenter.nodes n ON rs.id = n.id
  WHERE
    n.type :: TEXT = 'real'
  UNION
  ALL --Residual node selected
  SELECT
    cr.node_id AS node_id,
    cr.node_name AS node_name,
    cr.measurement_name AS measurement,
    -- The sign is determined by the top-level edge type for the parent
    CASE
      WHEN cr.top_child_edge_type :: TEXT IN ('supply', 'aggregate') THEN 1
      WHEN cr.top_child_edge_type :: TEXT = 'include' THEN -1
      ELSE 0
    END AS sign
  FROM
    child_recipes cr
    JOIN (
      SELECT
        id AS residual_id,
        title AS residual_name
      FROM
        datapresenter.nodes
      WHERE
        id = (
          SELECT
            node_id
          FROM
            params
        )
        AND type :: TEXT = 'residual'
    ) ri ON TRUE
  WHERE
    cr.node_type :: TEXT = 'real'
),
/*
 
 DATA PRESENTER PART END
 Recipe (measurement names) to calculate the selected node's data is in the node_list CTE.
 
 You are free to query any data based on this list from this point,
 
 ***DATA QUERY PART START***
 */
time_selector AS (
  SELECT
    '${selectedYear}-${selectedMonth}-01 00:00:00 Europe/Berlin' :: timestamptz - INTERVAL '10 hours' AS startTime
),
variables AS (
  SELECT
    ${selectedYear} AS startYear,
    ${selectedMonth} AS startMonth
),
raw_data AS (
  SELECT
    time_bucket_gapfill('1 hour', timestamp) AS timestamp,
    measurement,
    interpolate(MAX(heat_energy_total)) AS heat_energy_total
  FROM
    heat_energy_hourly,
    time_selector ts
  WHERE
    measurement IN (
      SELECT
        measurement
      FROM
        node_list
    )
    AND timestamp >= ts.startTime
    AND timestamp <= ts.startTime + INTERVAL '1 month' + INTERVAL '5 days'
  GROUP BY
    time_bucket_gapfill('1 hour', timestamp),
    measurement
),
consumption_data AS (
  SELECT
    timestamp,
    measurement,
    heat_energy_total - LAG(heat_energy_total) OVER (
      PARTITION BY measurement
      ORDER BY
        timestamp
    ) AS Consumption,
    EXTRACT(
      MONTH
      FROM
        timestamp AT TIME ZONE 'Europe/Berlin'
    ) AS rowMonth
  FROM
    raw_data
),
signed_consumption_data AS (
  SELECT
    c.timestamp,
    c.measurement,
    m.node_name,
    m.sign,
    c.consumption * m.sign AS consumption,
    c.rowMonth
  FROM
    consumption_data c
    JOIN node_list m ON m.measurement = c.measurement
),
monthly_data AS (
  SELECT
    timestamp AS stamp,
    SUM(Consumption) AS Consumption
  FROM
    signed_consumption_data,
    variables v
  WHERE
    rowMonth = v.startMonth
  GROUP BY
    timestamp
)
SELECT
  TO_CHAR(stamp AT TIME ZONE 'Europe/Berlin', 'DD. MM.') AS Date,
  stamp AT TIME ZONE 'Europe/Berlin' AS _time,
  CASE
    WHEN Consumption < 0 THEN 0
    ELSE Consumption
  END
FROM
  monthly_data
ORDER BY
  stamp ASC

/* DATA PRESENTER PART START
*/
WITH RECURSIVE params AS (
  SELECT
    n.id AS node_id
  FROM
    datapresenter.nodes n
    JOIN datapresenter.views v ON n.id = v.main_node_id
    AND v.id = ${view} 
),
real_suppliers AS (
  SELECT
    n.id,
    n.type,
    n.title,
    0 AS level,
    ARRAY [n.id] AS path
  FROM
    datapresenter.nodes n
    JOIN params p ON n.id = p.node_id
  UNION
  ALL
  SELECT
    c.id,
    c.type,
    c.title,
    rs.level + 1 AS level,
    rs.path || c.id AS path
  FROM
    real_suppliers rs
    JOIN datapresenter.edges e ON rs.id = e.parent_id
    JOIN datapresenter.nodes c ON e.child_id = c.id
  WHERE
    e.edge_type :: TEXT IN ('supply', 'aggregate')
    AND c.id <> ALL(rs.path)
),
parent_params AS(
  SELECT
    e.parent_id
  FROM
    datapresenter.edges e
  WHERE
    e.child_id = (SELECT node_id FROM params)
    AND e.edge_type :: TEXT = 'remainder'
),
child_recipes AS (
  SELECT
    n.id AS node_id,
    n.type AS node_type,
    n.title AS node_name,
    n.measurement_name,
    e.child_id AS top_child_id,
    e.edge_type AS top_child_edge_type,
    n.title AS top_child_name,
    ARRAY [n.id] AS path
  FROM
    datapresenter.nodes n
    JOIN datapresenter.edges e ON n.id = e.child_id
  WHERE
    e.parent_id = (SELECT parent_id FROM parent_params)
    AND e.edge_type :: TEXT <> 'remainder'
  UNION
  ALL
  SELECT
    c.id AS node_id,
    c.type AS node_type,
    c.title AS node_name,
    c.measurement_name,
    cr.top_child_id,
    cr.top_child_edge_type,
    cr.top_child_name,
    cr.path || c.id AS path
  FROM
    child_recipes cr
    JOIN datapresenter.edges e ON cr.node_id = e.parent_id
    JOIN datapresenter.nodes c ON e.child_id = c.id
  WHERE
    cr.node_type :: TEXT <> 'real'
    AND c.id <> ALL(cr.path)
    AND e.edge_type :: TEXT IN ('supply', 'aggregate')
),
node_list AS (
  SELECT
    DISTINCT n.id AS real_node_id,
    n.title AS node_name,
    n.measurement_name AS measurement,
    + 1 AS sign
  FROM
    real_suppliers rs
    JOIN datapresenter.nodes n ON rs.id = n.id
  WHERE
    n.type :: TEXT = 'real'
  UNION
  ALL
  SELECT
    cr.node_id AS node_id,
    cr.node_name AS node_name,
    cr.measurement_name AS measurement,
    CASE
      WHEN cr.top_child_edge_type :: TEXT IN ('supply', 'aggregate') THEN 1
      WHEN cr.top_child_edge_type :: TEXT = 'include' THEN -1
      ELSE 0
    END AS sign
  FROM
    child_recipes cr
    JOIN (
      SELECT
        id AS residual_id,
        title AS residual_name
      FROM
        datapresenter.nodes
      WHERE
        id = (SELECT node_id FROM params)
        AND type :: TEXT = 'residual'
    ) ri ON TRUE
  WHERE
    cr.node_type :: TEXT = 'real'
),
/* DATA PRESENTER PART END
  
  FORECAST LOGIC PART START
*/
time_selector AS (
  SELECT
    ('${selectedYear}-${selectedMonth}-01 00:00:00 Europe/Berlin')::timestamptz AS month_start,
    (('${selectedYear}-${selectedMonth}-01 00:00:00 Europe/Berlin')::timestamptz + INTERVAL '1 month')::timestamptz AS next_month_start,
    ('${selectedYear}-${selectedMonth}-01 00:00:00 Europe/Berlin')::timestamptz - INTERVAL '2 months' AS avg_period_start
),
raw_data AS (
  SELECT
    time_bucket('1 hour', timestamp) AS timestamp_hour,
    measurement,
    MAX(heat_energy_total) AS heat_energy_total
  FROM
    heat_energy_hourly, time_selector ts 
  WHERE
    timestamp >= ts.avg_period_start
    AND timestamp < ts.next_month_start + INTERVAL '3 days'
    AND measurement IN (SELECT measurement FROM node_list) 
  GROUP BY
    timestamp_hour, measurement
),
consumption_data AS (
  SELECT
    timestamp_hour,
    measurement,
    COALESCE(
      heat_energy_total - LAG(heat_energy_total) OVER (PARTITION BY measurement ORDER BY timestamp_hour),
      0
    ) AS Consumption
  FROM
    raw_data
),
signed_consumption_data AS (
  SELECT
    cd.timestamp_hour,
    cd.Consumption * nl.sign AS Consumption
  FROM
    consumption_data cd
  JOIN node_list nl ON cd.measurement = nl.measurement
),
full_hourly_consumption AS (
  SELECT
    timestamp_hour AS stamp,
    SUM(CASE WHEN Consumption < 0 THEN 0 ELSE Consumption END) AS Consumption
  FROM
    signed_consumption_data
  GROUP BY
    timestamp_hour
),
selected_month_actual_hourly AS (
  SELECT
    stamp,
    Consumption
  FROM
    full_hourly_consumption, time_selector ts
  WHERE
    stamp >= ts.month_start
    AND stamp < ts.next_month_start
),
last_actual_data AS (
  SELECT
    MAX(stamp) AS last_stamp
  FROM
    selected_month_actual_hourly
),
historical_avg_dow_hour AS (
  SELECT
    EXTRACT(DOW FROM fhc.stamp AT TIME ZONE 'Europe/Berlin') AS day_of_week,
    EXTRACT(HOUR FROM fhc.stamp AT TIME ZONE 'Europe/Berlin') AS hour_of_day,
    AVG(fhc.Consumption) AS avg_consumption
  FROM
    full_hourly_consumption fhc,
    last_actual_data lad,
    time_selector ts
  WHERE
    (lad.last_stamp IS NOT NULL AND fhc.stamp <= lad.last_stamp)
    OR (lad.last_stamp IS NULL AND fhc.stamp < ts.month_start)
  GROUP BY
    day_of_week,
    hour_of_day
  HAVING
    AVG(fhc.Consumption) >= 0
),
month_timestamps AS (
  SELECT
    generate_series(
      ts.month_start,
      ts.next_month_start - INTERVAL '1 hour',
      '1 hour'
    ) AS stamp
  FROM
    time_selector ts
),
full_month_forecast_hourly AS (
  SELECT
    mt.stamp,
    COALESCE(hist_avg.avg_consumption, 0) AS forecast_consumption
  FROM
    month_timestamps mt
  LEFT JOIN
    historical_avg_dow_hour hist_avg ON
      EXTRACT(DOW FROM mt.stamp AT TIME ZONE 'Europe/Berlin') = hist_avg.day_of_week
      AND EXTRACT(HOUR FROM mt.stamp AT TIME ZONE 'Europe/Berlin') = hist_avg.hour_of_day
),
combined_hourly_data AS (
  SELECT
    fmfc.stamp,
    COALESCE(sma.Consumption, fmfc.forecast_consumption) AS Consumption,
    CASE
      WHEN sma.stamp IS NOT NULL THEN 'Actual'
      WHEN fmfc.stamp > COALESCE(lad.last_stamp, ts.month_start - INTERVAL '1 second') THEN 'Forecast'
      ELSE 'Actual'
    END AS data_type
  FROM
    full_month_forecast_hourly fmfc
  LEFT JOIN
    selected_month_actual_hourly sma ON fmfc.stamp = sma.stamp
  CROSS JOIN
    last_actual_data lad
  CROSS JOIN
    time_selector ts
)
SELECT
  TO_CHAR(chd.stamp AT TIME ZONE 'Europe/Berlin', 'DD. MM.') AS "Date",
  chd.stamp AT TIME ZONE 'Europe/Berlin' AS _time,
  CASE
    WHEN chd.data_type = 'Actual' THEN CASE WHEN chd.Consumption < 0 THEN 0 ELSE chd.Consumption END
    ELSE NULL
  END AS "Actual",
  CASE
    WHEN chd.data_type = 'Forecast' THEN CASE WHEN chd.Consumption < 0 THEN 0 ELSE chd.Consumption END
    ELSE NULL
  END AS "Forecast"
FROM
  combined_hourly_data chd
  CROSS JOIN last_actual_data lad
  CROSS JOIN time_selector ts
WHERE
  chd.data_type = 'Actual'
  OR (
    chd.data_type = 'Forecast'
    AND chd.stamp < (
      DATE_TRUNC('day', COALESCE(lad.last_stamp, ts.month_start) AT TIME ZONE 'Europe/Berlin')
      + INTERVAL '4 days' - INTERVAL '3 hours'
    )
  )
ORDER BY
  _time ASC;

/*DATA PRESENTER QUERY
 
 This part will select all real measurements connected to the displayed view. The result will be used for any needed calculation.
 */
--Select a real node or if the selected node is virtual, select all it's real supply nodes
WITH RECURSIVE params AS (
  SELECT
    n.id AS node_id
  FROM
    datapresenter.nodes n
    JOIN datapresenter.views v ON n.id = v.main_node_id
    AND v.id = $view
),
-- The recursive CTE to find all REAL supplier nodes through a downward traversal
real_suppliers AS (
  -- Anchor: The selected node to start the traversal
  SELECT
    n.id,
    n.type,
    n.title,
    0 AS level,
    ARRAY [n.id] AS path
  FROM
    datapresenter.nodes n
    JOIN params p ON n.id = p.node_id
  UNION
  ALL -- Recursive part: Find the children of the current set of nodes
  SELECT
    c.id,
    c.type,
    c.title,
    rs.level + 1 AS level,
    rs.path || c.id AS path
  FROM
    real_suppliers rs
    JOIN datapresenter.edges e ON rs.id = e.parent_id
    JOIN datapresenter.nodes c ON e.child_id = c.id
  WHERE
    e.edge_type :: TEXT IN ('supply', 'aggregate')
    AND c.id <> ALL(rs.path) -- Cycle detection
),
--If a node is a remainder, find all it's siblings and prepare a recipe for calculating the consumption.
parent_params AS(
  SELECT
    e.parent_id
  FROM
    datapresenter.edges e
  WHERE
    e.child_id = (
      SELECT
        node_id
      FROM
        params
    )
    AND e.edge_type :: TEXT = 'remainder'
),
-- The universal recursive CTE to find all REAL descendants, preserving the original child's context
child_recipes AS (
  -- Anchor: The direct children of the parent
  SELECT
    n.id AS node_id,
    n.type AS node_type,
    n.title AS node_name,
    n.measurement_name,
    e.child_id AS top_child_id,
    e.edge_type AS top_child_edge_type,
    n.title AS top_child_name,
    ARRAY [n.id] AS path
  FROM
    datapresenter.nodes n
    JOIN datapresenter.edges e ON n.id = e.child_id
  WHERE
    e.parent_id = (
      SELECT
        parent_id
      FROM
        parent_params
    ) -- We filter the anchor to not include the residual node itself, as its recipe is different
    AND e.edge_type :: TEXT <> 'remainder'
  UNION
  ALL -- Recursive part: Find the suppliers for the current virtual nodes
  SELECT
    c.id AS node_id,
    c.type AS node_type,
    c.title AS node_name,
    c.measurement_name,
    cr.top_child_id,
    cr.top_child_edge_type,
    cr.top_child_name,
    cr.path || c.id AS path
  FROM
    child_recipes cr
    JOIN datapresenter.edges e ON cr.node_id = e.parent_id
    JOIN datapresenter.nodes c ON e.child_id = c.id
  WHERE
    cr.node_type :: TEXT <> 'real' -- Stop when we hit a REAL node
    AND c.id <> ALL(cr.path) -- Cycle detection
    -- Only traverse 'supply' and 'aggregate' edges
    AND e.edge_type :: TEXT IN ('supply', 'aggregate')
),
-- Final recipe for calculating of the consumption.
node_list AS (
  -- Real or virtual node selected
  -- Final SELECT to get the real nodes found in the traversal, all with a +1 sign
  SELECT
    DISTINCT n.id AS real_node_id,
    n.title AS node_name,
    n.measurement_name AS measurement,
    + 1 AS sign
  FROM
    real_suppliers rs
    JOIN datapresenter.nodes n ON rs.id = n.id
  WHERE
    n.type :: TEXT = 'real'
  UNION
  ALL --Residual node selected
  SELECT
    cr.node_id AS node_id,
    cr.node_name AS node_name,
    cr.measurement_name AS measurement,
    -- The sign is determined by the top-level edge type for the parent
    CASE
      WHEN cr.top_child_edge_type :: TEXT IN ('supply', 'aggregate') THEN 1
      WHEN cr.top_child_edge_type :: TEXT = 'include' THEN -1
      ELSE 0
    END AS sign
  FROM
    child_recipes cr
    JOIN (
      SELECT
        id AS residual_id,
        title AS residual_name
      FROM
        datapresenter.nodes
      WHERE
        id = (
          SELECT
            node_id
          FROM
            params
        )
        AND type :: TEXT = 'residual'
    ) ri ON TRUE
  WHERE
    cr.node_type :: TEXT = 'real'
),
/*
 
 DATA PRESENTER PART END
 Recipe (measurement names) to calculate the selected node's data is in the node_list CTE.
 
 You are free to query any data based on this list from this point,
 
 ***DATA QUERY PART START***
 */
mid AS (
  SELECT
    (
      SELECT
        MAX(timestamp) AT TIME ZONE 'Europe/Berlin'
      FROM
        public.electrometers
      WHERE
        timestamp BETWEEN '${selectedYear}-${selectedMonth}-01 00:00:00 Europe/Berlin' :: timestamptz
        AND '${selectedYear}-${selectedMonth}-01 00:00:00 Europe/Berlin' :: timestamptz + INTERVAL '1 month, 5 days'
    ) AS midTime
),
time_selector AS (
  SELECT
    '${selectedYear}-${selectedMonth}-01 00:00:00 Europe/Berlin' :: timestamptz - INTERVAL '1 month, 2 days' AS startTime,
    '${selectedYear}-${selectedMonth}-01 00:00:00 Europe/Berlin' :: timestamptz + INTERVAL '1 month, 5 days' AS endTime
),
variables AS (
  SELECT
    ${selectedYear} AS startYear,
    ${selectedMonth} AS startMonth,
    EXTRACT(
      DAY
      FROM
        (ts.midTime - INTERVAL '1 month') AT TIME ZONE 'Europe/Berlin'
    ) AS midLastDay,
    EXTRACT(
      MONTH
      FROM
        (ts.midTime - INTERVAL '1 month') AT TIME ZONE 'Europe/Berlin'
    ) AS midLastMonth
  FROM
    mid ts
),
raw_data AS (
  SELECT
    time_bucket_gapfill(
      '1 hour',
      timestamp,
      'Europe/Berlin',
      ts.startTime,
      ts.endTime
    ) AS timestamp,
    measurement,
    interpolate(MAX(heat_energy_total)) AS heat_energy_total
  FROM
    heat_energy_hourly,
    time_selector ts
  WHERE
    measurement IN (
      SELECT
        measurement
      FROM
        node_list
    )
    AND timestamp >= ts.startTime
    AND timestamp <= ts.endTime
  GROUP BY
    time_bucket_gapfill(
      '1 hour',
      timestamp,
      'Europe/Berlin',
      ts.startTime,
      ts.endTime
    ),
    measurement
),
consumption_data AS (
  SELECT
    timestamp,
    measurement,
    EXTRACT(
      MONTH
      FROM
        (timestamp) AT TIME ZONE 'Europe/Berlin'
    ) AS filterMonth,
    EXTRACT(
      DAY
      FROM
        (timestamp) AT TIME ZONE 'Europe/Berlin'
    ) AS filterDay,
    heat_energy_total - LAG(heat_energy_total) OVER (
      PARTITION BY measurement
      ORDER BY
        timestamp
    ) AS Consumption
  FROM
    raw_data
),
signed_consumption_data AS (
  SELECT
    c.timestamp,
    c.measurement,
    n.node_name,
    n.sign,
    c.consumption * n.sign AS consumption,
    c.filterMonth,
    c.filterDay
  FROM
    consumption_data c
    JOIN node_list n ON c.measurement = n.measurement
),
combined_data AS (
  SELECT
    timestamp,
    MAX(filterMonth) AS filter_month,
    MAX(filterDay) AS filter_day,
    SUM(Consumption) AS Consumption
  FROM
    signed_consumption_data
  GROUP BY
    timestamp

    ) -- We filter the anchor to not include the residual node itself, as its recipe is different
    AND e.edge_type :: TEXT <> 'remainder'
  UNION

/*
 
 DATA PRESENTER PART END
 Recipe (measurement names) to calculate the selected node's data is in the node_list CTE.
 
 You are free to query any data based on this list from this point,
 
 ***DATA QUERY PART START***
 */
variables AS (
  SELECT
    EXTRACT(
      DAY
      FROM
        (NOW() - INTERVAL '1 day') AT TIME ZONE 'Europe/Berlin'
    ) AS yesterday,
    EXTRACT(
      DAY
      FROM
        NOW() AT TIME ZONE 'Europe/Berlin'
    ) AS today
),
raw_data AS (
  SELECT
    time_bucket_gapfill('1 hour' :: INTERVAL, timestamp) AS hourly_bucket,
    measurement,
    interpolate(MAX(heat_energy_total)) AS heat_energy_total
  FROM
    heat_energy_hourly
  WHERE
    measurement IN (
      SELECT
        measurement
      FROM
        node_list
    )
    AND timestamp BETWEEN NOW() - INTERVAL '2 days'
    AND NOW()
  GROUP BY
    time_bucket_gapfill('1 hour' :: INTERVAL, timestamp),
    measurement
),
raw_consumption AS (
  SELECT
    hourly_bucket,
    measurement,
    EXTRACT(
      DAY
      FROM
        hourly_bucket AT TIME ZONE 'Europe/Berlin'
    ) AS filter_day,
    heat_energy_total - LAG(heat_energy_total) OVER (
      PARTITION BY measurement
      ORDER BY
        hourly_bucket
    ) AS Consumption
  FROM
    raw_data
),
signed_consumption AS (
  SELECT
    c.hourly_bucket,
    c.measurement,
    n.node_name,
    n.sign,
    c.consumption * n.sign AS consumption,
    c.filter_day
  FROM
    raw_consumption c
    JOIN node_list n ON c.measurement = n.measurement
),
combined_consumption AS (
  SELECT
    hourly_bucket,
    MAX(filter_day) AS filter_day,
    SUM(Consumption) AS Consumption
  FROM
    signed_consumption
  GROUP BY
    hourly_bucket
),
filtered_consumption AS (
  SELECT
    hourly_bucket AS _time,
    CASE
      WHEN (
        filter_day = today
        AND hourly_bucket <= NOW()
      )
      OR (
        filter_day = yesterday
        AND hourly_bucket <= NOW() - INTERVAL '1 day'
      ) THEN Consumption
      ELSE 0
    END AS daily_consumption,
    filter_day
  FROM
    combined_consumption,
    variables
  WHERE
    filter_day = today
    OR filter_day = yesterday
  ORDER BY
    hourly_bucket
)
SELECT
  *
FROM
  filtered_consumption

 You are free to query any data based on this list from this point,
 
 ***DATA QUERY PART START***
 */
time_range AS (
  SELECT
    CASE
      WHEN EXTRACT(
        EPOCH
        FROM
          (
            $__timeTo() :: TIMESTAMP - $__timeFrom() :: TIMESTAMP
          )
      ) <= 12 * 3600 THEN INTERVAL '5 minutes'
      WHEN EXTRACT(
        EPOCH
        FROM
          (
            $__timeTo() :: TIMESTAMP - $__timeFrom() :: TIMESTAMP
          )
      ) <= 24 * 3600 THEN INTERVAL '10 minutes'
      WHEN EXTRACT(
        EPOCH
        FROM
          (
            $__timeTo() :: TIMESTAMP - $__timeFrom() :: TIMESTAMP
          )
      ) <= 7 * 24 * 3600 THEN INTERVAL '30 minutes'
      WHEN EXTRACT(
        EPOCH
        FROM
          (
            $__timeTo() :: TIMESTAMP - $__timeFrom() :: TIMESTAMP
          )
      ) <= 30 * 24 * 3600 THEN INTERVAL '1 hour'
      ELSE INTERVAL '1 hour'
    END AS aggregationWindow
),
raw_data AS (
  SELECT
    time_bucket_gapfill(aggregationWindow, timestamp) AS bucket,
    measurement,
    interpolate(MAX(heat_energy_total :: NUMERIC)) AS heat_energy_total
  FROM
    heat_energy_5min,
    time_range
  WHERE
    timestamp BETWEEN '${__from:date:YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss} Europe/Berlin'
    AND '${__to:date:YYYY-MM-DD HH:mm:ss} Europe/Berlin'
    AND measurement IN (
      SELECT
        measurement
      FROM
        node_list
    )
  GROUP BY
    time_bucket_gapfill(aggregationWindow, timestamp),
    measurement
),
consumption AS (
  SELECT
    bucket AS _time,
    measurement,
    heat_energy_total - LAG(heat_energy_total) OVER (
      PARTITION BY measurement
      ORDER BY
        bucket
    ) AS Consumption
  FROM
    raw_data
),
signed_consumption AS (
  SELECT
    c._time,
    c.measurement,
    n.node_name,
    n.sign,
    c.consumption * n.sign AS consumption
  FROM
    consumption c
    JOIN node_list n ON c.measurement = n.measurement
)
SELECT
  _time,
  TO_CHAR(_time, 'YYYY-MM-DDT') || TO_CHAR(_time, 'HH24:00:00Z') AS _time_string,
  SUM(consumption) AS consumption
FROM
  signed_consumption
GROUP BY
  _time

      FROM
        datapresenter.nodes
      WHERE
        id = (
          SELECT
            node_id
          FROM
            params
        )
        AND type :: TEXT = 'residual'
    ) ri ON TRUE

            $__timeTo() :: TIMESTAMP - $__timeFrom() :: TIMESTAMP

        EPOCH
        FROM
          (
            $__timeTo() :: TIMESTAMP - $__timeFrom() :: TIMESTAMP
          )
      ) <= 24 * 3600 THEN INTERVAL '5 minutes'
      WHEN EXTRACT(
        EPOCH
        FROM
          (
            $__timeTo() :: TIMESTAMP - $__timeFrom() :: TIMESTAMP
          )
      ) <= 7 * 24 * 3600 THEN INTERVAL '15 minutes'

        EPOCH
        FROM
          (
            $__timeTo() :: TIMESTAMP - $__timeFrom() :: TIMESTAMP
          )

    END AS aggregationWindow
),
raw_data AS (

    n.id AS node_id
  FROM
    datapresenter.nodes n
    JOIN datapresenter.views v ON n.id = v.main_node_id
    AND v.id = $view
),
-- The recursive CTE to find all REAL supplier nodes through a downward traversal
real_suppliers AS (
  -- Anchor: The selected node to start the traversal
  SELECT
    n.id,
    n.type,
    n.title,
    0 AS level,
    ARRAY [n.id] AS path
  FROM
    datapresenter.nodes n
    JOIN params p ON n.id = p.node_id
  UNION
  ALL -- Recursive part: Find the children of the current set of nodes
  SELECT
    c.id,
    c.type,
    c.title,
    rs.level + 1 AS level,
    rs.path || c.id AS path
  FROM
    real_suppliers rs
    JOIN datapresenter.edges e ON rs.id = e.parent_id
    JOIN datapresenter.nodes c ON e.child_id = c.id
  WHERE
    e.edge_type :: TEXT IN ('supply', 'aggregate')

  -- Anchor: The direct children of the parent
  SELECT
    n.id AS node_id,
    n.type AS node_type,
    n.title AS node_name,
    n.measurement_name,
    e.child_id AS top_child_id,
    e.edge_type AS top_child_edge_type,
    n.title AS top_child_name,

        parent_id
      FROM

    c.type AS node_type,
    c.title AS node_name,
    c.measurement_name,
    cr.top_child_id,
    cr.top_child_edge_type,
    cr.top_child_name,

    child_recipes cr

    cr.node_type :: TEXT <> 'real' -- Stop when we hit a REAL node
    AND c.id <> ALL(cr.path) -- Cycle detection

    AND e.edge_type :: TEXT IN ('supply', 'aggregate')

  SELECT

      WHEN cr.top_child_edge_type :: TEXT IN ('supply', 'aggregate') THEN 1
      WHEN cr.top_child_edge_type :: TEXT = 'include' THEN -1

    END AS sign
  FROM
    child_recipes cr
    JOIN (
      SELECT
        id AS residual_id,
        title AS residual_name
      FROM
        datapresenter.nodes
      WHERE
        id = (
          SELECT
            node_id

            params
        )

SELECT
  v.id AS __value,
  v.name AS __text
FROM
  datapresenter.views v
JOIN
  datapresenter.nodes n ON n.id = v.main_node_id
WHERE
  n.type_string = 'Kalorimeter'
ORDER BY v.name DESC
